Package com.jmill29.tvtrackerapi.service

Class UserServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.jmill29.tvtrackerapi.service.UserServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserService
@Service public class UserServiceImpl extends Object implements UserService
Service implementation for user-related operations.

This class provides the business logic for handling user data, delegating persistence operations to the UserDao.

    • save

      public boolean save(User user) throws IllegalArgumentException, DatabaseException, UserNotFoundException, UserAlreadyExistsException
      Saves a new user or updates an existing one.

      If the user's ID is 0, a new user will be inserted. Otherwise, the user will be updated based on the provided ID.

      Specified by:
      save in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to save or update
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user is null or contains invalid fields
      DatabaseException - if a database access error occurs
      UserNotFoundException
      UserAlreadyExistsException

    • registerUser

      public boolean registerUser(UserRequest user) throws IllegalArgumentException, DatabaseException, UserAlreadyExistsException
      Registers a new user in the system.

      Validates the provided UserRequest and attempts to create a new user account. If a user with the same username already exists, a UserAlreadyExistsException is thrown.

      Implementation notes:

      • Throws IllegalArgumentException if the input user is null.
      • Creates a new User entity with the provided registration details. The user ID is set to 0 to indicate a new user.
      • Attempts to persist the new user and assign the default role "ROLE_USER".
      • If either the save or role assignment fails, returns false.
      • If a SQLException occurs during either operation, wraps and throws it as a DatabaseException.
      • Side effect: If user creation succeeds but role assignment fails, the user will exist in the database without the intended role.
      Specified by:
      registerUser in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      user - the UserRequest containing user registration details
      Returns:
      true if the user was registered successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user request is null or contains invalid fields
      DatabaseException - if a database access error occurs
      UserAlreadyExistsException - if a user with the same username already exists
      See Also:
      • UserService.registerUser(UserRequest)
